Controls the language of news stories and their content.

• Default: Most categories in your browser language ({{browserLang}}), countries in local language
• Source: All content in original language
• Other: All content translated to selected language

settings.sync.clear.confirmMessage.text: This will permanently delete all your synced settings and read history from Kagi servers. Your local data will remain intact.

settings.sync.export.errorNotLoggedIn.text: You must be logged in to export synced data
settings.sync.export.errorNotLoggedIn.translationContext: Error message when trying to export data while not logged in

settings.sync.info.description.text:
Kagi News can sync your settings and read history across all your devices. This data is stored securely on Kagi servers and associated with your Kagi Search account.

Your synced data is not used for any other purpose, not shared with anyone, and is solely stored to provide the sync service to you. You have full control over what gets synced and can delete your data at any time.
settings.sync.info.description.translationContext: Description of sync and privacy features

settings.sync.notLoggedIn.description.text: Sign in to your Kagi account to sync your settings and read history across devices.

about.approach.description1.text: World doesn't live in echo chambers. The reality emerges from the collision of different viewpoints and perspectives - that's how we separate signal from noise.
about.approach.description1.translationContext: First paragraph of the approach section

about.approach.description2.text: We strive for diversity and transparency of resources and welcome your contributions to widen perspectives. This multi-source approach helps reveal the full picture beyond any single viewpoint.
about.approach.description2.translationContext: Second paragraph of the approach section with GitHub link

about.approach.description3.text: Kagi News reads public RSS feeds of thousands of (community-curated) world-wide news sources and distills them into one perfect daily briefing. You get every critical perspective and timeline in just 5 minutes. That's it. No endless scrolling. No attention hijacking. Because we deserve better.
about.approach.description3.translationContext: Third paragraph of the approach section

about.contact.description.text: For feedback, please use Kagi Feedback. For support, support@kagi.com.

about.customization.description.text: Personalize your feed by reordering and toggling categories in settings. Want to contribute? Most of Kagi News is open source, including our web app and community-curated feeds.
about.customization.description.translationContext: Description of customization options with GitHub link

about.principles.item1.text: One daily update (~noon UTC), creating a natural endpoint to your news consumption
about.principles.item1.translationContext: First core principle about daily updates

about.principles.item2.text: Focus on facts and perspectives over opinions
about.principles.item2.translationContext: Second core principle about facts vs opinions

about.principles.item3.text: Zero compromise on privacy - your reading habits are yours alone

about.principles.item5.translationContext: Fifth core principle about time efficiency

about.principles.item6.text: Liberation from the attention economy - exist in the moment, not in an endless scroll
about.principles.item6.translationContext: Sixth core principle about attention economy

about.principles.title.translationContext: Title of the core principles section

about.subtitle.translationContext: Kagi is a company, should not be translated

about.understand.button.translationContext: Text for the I understand button

about.why.description.text: Driven by relentless ad monetization, news has become mental junk food - an endless stream of clickbait that destroys our ability to think deeply and clearly. We can do better, and create what news should have been all along - pure, essential information that respects your intelligence and time.
about.why.description.translationContext: Description of why Kagi News exists, including HTML link

about.why.title.text: Why Kagi News? Because news is broken.
about.why.title.translationContext: Title of the Why Kagi News section

meta.categoryDescription.translationContext: Meta description for category pages. {category} will be replaced with the actual category name.

meta.description.text: Kagi News distills thousands of world-wide news sources into one perfect daily briefing. Get every critical perspective in just 5 minutes. No endless scrolling. No attention hijacking.

navigation.backToTop.translationContext: Accessibility label for the button that scrolls back to the top of the page

notification.newBatch.action.translationContext: Action button label on toast notification to view the new batch of news

notification.newBatch.message.translationContext: Toast notification message when a new batch of news is published

onboarding.categories.subtitle.text: Kagi News follows news from around the world, covering national, regional, and local events. Select the categories you're interested in:

onboarding.sections.subtitle.text: Kagi News articles include various sections like summaries, key points, timelines, and different perspectives. You can reorder these sections by dragging or disable them entirely based on your reading preferences.

onboarding.welcome.subtitle.text: Let's personalize your news experience. First, choose your preferences:

onthisday.events.translationContext: Title for the events section in Today in History

onthisday.people.translationContext: Title for the people section in Today in History

quote.format.authorSaid.translationContext: Quote author prefix. {author} is the person who said the quote

quote.format.full.translationContext: Full quote format with attribution and author. {attribution} is the source/publication, {author} is the person, {quote} is the actual quote

quote.format.inAttribution.translationContext: Quote attribution prefix for the source/publication only. {attribution} is the source/publication

worldTension.aboutTitle.translationContext: Title for the world tension explanation

worldTension.backToIndex.translationContext: Button text to return from explanation to main view

worldTension.burning.translationContext: Temperature description for extreme world tension (81-100%)

worldTension.chaosIndex.translationContext: Label for the chaos index chart

worldTension.cool.translationContext: Temperature description for low world tension (0-20%)

worldTension.critical.translationContext: Status label for 61-80% range (deprecated, use hot)

worldTension.elevated.translationContext: Status label for 21-40% range (deprecated, use mild)

worldTension.explanation1.text: The World Tension index provides a temperature reading of global stability based on current events.
worldTension.explanation1.translationContext: First paragraph of world tension explanation

worldTension.explanation2.text: By analyzing headlines from around the world, we track patterns of conflict, crisis, and instability to create a simple metric that shows how "heated" global affairs are at any given moment.
worldTension.explanation2.translationContext: Second paragraph of world tension explanation

worldTension.explanation3.text: Think of it as a global thermometer - when tensions rise due to conflicts, disasters, or political turmoil, the temperature goes up. During calmer periods of stability and cooperation, it cools down.
worldTension.explanation3.translationContext: Third paragraph of world tension explanation

worldTension.extreme.translationContext: Status label for 81-100% range (deprecated, use burning)

worldTension.high.translationContext: Status label for 41-60% range (deprecated, use warm)

worldTension.hot.translationContext: Temperature description for serious world tension (61-80%)

worldTension.mild.translationContext: Temperature description for normal world tension (21-40%)

worldTension.stable.translationContext: Status label for 0-20% range (deprecated, use cool)

worldTension.title.translationContext: Title for the world tension modal

worldTension.trendTitle.translationContext: Title for the historical trend chart

worldTension.warm.translationContext: Temperature description for elevated world tension (41-60%)

worldTension.whatIsThis.translationContext: Button text to show explanation of world tension
